content.full_text:
Abraham Lincoln to John M. Clayton, 12 March 18491 John C. Richardson, ofBoonville, Mo– is, or will be an applicant for U.S. Marshall in thatstate– He is a family relative of mine, and has desired me to aid him in the matter– That
               being an office not in my ownstate, I feel I have no right to interfere, farther than to say he is a most worthy and
               competent man, to fill that or any such office, and that, if without injustice to
               those whom it particularly concerns, he can receive it, I shall be gratified–2
